alert.note: Alert for Bourbon (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 2:12AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bourbon, northeastern Crawford, northwestern Barton and Vernon Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 211 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Arcadia, or 7 miles south of Fort Scott, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Prairie State Park... Nevada... Fort Scott... Arma... Liberal... Sheldon... Mulberry... Montevallo... Arcadia... Walker... Schell City... Bronaugh... Moundville... Richards... Milo... Deerfield... Burgess... Metz... Harwood... Croweburg... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 74 and 104. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for southeastern Kansas...and southwestern and west central Missouri.
